title: [BUG] TypeError: Object of type Response is not JSON serializable
body:
# System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**:
- ** Linux Ubuntu 18.04**:
- **MLflow installed from (binary)**:
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --1.4.0``)**:
- **Python version 3.7 **:
- **r = requests.post(url, data=values.to_json(orient='split'), headers=headers)**:

2019/12/17 18:20:56 ERROR mlflow.pyfunc.scoring_server: Exception on /invocations [POST]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 2446, in wsgi_app
    response = self.full_dispatch_request()
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1951, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.handle_user_exception(e)
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1820, in handle_user_exception
    reraise(exc_type, exc_value, tb)
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/_compat.py", line 39, in reraise
    raise value
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1949, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.dispatch_request()
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/flask/app.py", line 1935, in dispatch_request
    return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args)
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/server/handlers.py", line 137, in wrapper
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/scoring_server/__init__.py", line 205, in transformation
    predictions_to_json(raw_predictions, result)
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/scoring_server/__init__.py", line 125, in predictions_to_json
    json.dump(predictions, output, cls=NumpyEncoder)
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/json/__init__.py", line 179, in dump
    for chunk in iterable:
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 438, in _iterencode
    o = _default(o)
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/pyfunc/scoring_server/__init__.py", line 245, in default
    return JSONEncoder.default(self, o)
  File "/home/llu/anaconda3/envs/mlflow-9fc830d9c10d5ff595cd4407b22104b0fd2478a2/lib/python3.7/json/encoder.py", line 179, in default
    raise TypeError(f'Object of type {o.__class__.__name__} '
TypeError: Object of type Response is not JSON serializable


Deployed and served scikit model calling deployed Keras model generated by mlflow, which means call rest api within rest api.
